intro: Protium araguense, commonly known as the Guianan copal tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces a sticky resin that has been used traditionally for various purposes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Protium araguense plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
